title: US House of Representatives passes $95 billion foreign aid bill for Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan
summary: After a monthslong stalemate, the House approved a $61-billion package for Ukraine's war effort, which is expected to swiftly pass through the US Senate.

title: Georgia's draft law targeting press freedom inspired by Moscow
summary: The controversial 'foreign influence' bill passed its first reading on Wednesday. It aims to silence journalists and civil society and jeopardizes the European aspirations of this former Soviet republic.

title: Japan's 'Naked festivals': Exorcism rituals featuring half-naked running men
summary: These ancient festivals, rooted in rites to local deities and expressing a 'virilist' Japanese aesthetic that resists Western modernity, continue to be popular and now include women in some rituals.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Nine members of a family killed in Gaza, Israel raids West Bank camp
summary: The Israeli army said it had killed 10 militants in the Nur Shams refugee camp in the West Bank, while a Palestinian official said homes and infrastructure were being destroyed.

title: Immigration: 'Some Canadians are beginning to question the multiculturalist model'
summary: Sociologist Christian Bergeron says the intense debate surrounding the recent influx of immigrants is shaking one of the pillars of Canadian society.

title: The high schoolers trying to cut screen time: 'TikTok is like smoking. We'd like to stop, but we can't.'
summary: Two PE teachers at a high school outside Paris are tracking the time spent by their 15 and 16-year-old students on their phones, to encourage them to 'do something else with their free time.' At the start of the school year, their average daily use was 7 hours and 22 minutes.

title: Women's Champions League: Lyon produce stunning back to beat PSG 3-2
summary: Lyon recovered from two goals down to win at home to French rivals PSG in the first leg of the semi-final. Meanwhile, Chelsea defeated defending champion Barcelona 1-0.

title: Man who set himself on fire outside Trump trial has died
summary: The man was rushed to treatment, but a spokesman for the New York Police Department said early Saturday that he had died.

title: Malmö prepares for a high-tension Eurovision contest
summary: Against the backdrop of the war in Gaza, the 2024 edition of the song competition, whose semi-finals will take place on May 7 and 9 and the final on May 11 in Sweden, will be supervised by heavy police presence.

title: 'Some US states have gone much further than France in constitutionally protecting reproductive freedom'
summary: Legal experts Daniel Borrillo and Thomas Perroud explain how, in many US states, abortion rights legislation is more protective of women's and men's freedoms than it is in France.

title: Iraq: Blast at army base leaves one dead, eight wounded
summary: Iraqi air defense command reported "no drones or combat aircraft in the airspace of Babylon province before or during the explosion."

title: US Congress renews controversial surveillance tool
summary: Lawmakers approved a tool used by American intelligence agencies to conduct electronic surveillance abroad without a warrant. The White House said Joe Biden will 'swiftly sign the bill into law.'

title: US agrees to pull over 1,000 troops from Niger
summary: The long-expected move effectively marks a new regional gain for Russia, which has ramped up its focus on Africa and backed military regimes in neighboring Mali and Burkina Faso.

title: UK rejects youth mobility deal with EU
summary: 'We are not introducing an EU-wide youth mobility scheme − free movement within the EU was ended and there are no plans to introduce it,' a government spokesman said.

title: France has helped over 260 people leave Gaza
summary: France has widened the eligibility criteria to evacuate as many Palestinians as possible from Gaza. All the French people who asked to leave have done so.

title: As drought lasts, Barcelona swaps water cargo ships for floating desalination plants
summary: Catalonia has announced the launch of a unit off the coast and mobile desalinators to supply the Costa Brava with water. Resources remain at an all-time low.

title: 6.24 meters: Armand Duplantis beats own pole vault world record
summary: The Swedish athlete improved his own world record set last year by one centimeter.

title: Five places to see horses with your children around Paris
summary: Whether it's a show by Bartabas, a visit to historic stables or a ride in the countryside, there's no shortage of opportunities to get up close and personal with some magnificent horses in and around Paris. There's something for the whole family.
